briefdescription.para: Explicitly initializes the HIP runtime.

detaileddescription.para: Most HIP APIs implicitly initialize the HIP runtime. This API provides control over the timing of the initialization.

briefdescription.para: Create a context and set it as current/ default context.

simplesect.para: hipCtxDestroy, hipCtxGetFlags, hipCtxPopCurrent, hipCtxGetCurrent, hipCtxPushCurrent, hipCtxSetCacheConfig, hipCtxSynchronize, hipCtxGetDevice

briefdescription.para: Returns a handle to a compute device.

simplesect.para: hipSuccess, #hipErrorInavlidDevice

briefdescription.para: Returns the approximate HIP driver version.

simplesect.para: hipSuccess, #hipErrorInavlidValue

The HIP feature set does not correspond to an exact CUDA SDK driver revision. This function always set *driverVersion to 4 as an approximation though HIP supports some features which were introduced in later CUDA SDK revisions. HIP apps code should not rely on the driver revision number here and should use arch feature flags to test device capabilities or conditional compilation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the approximate HIP Runtime version.

simplesect.para: hipSuccess, #hipErrorInavlidValue
On HIP/HCC path this function returns HIP runtime patch version however on HIP/NVCC path this function return CUDA runtime version.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a HIP context.

simplesect.para: hipSuccess, hipErrorInvalidValue
hipCtxCreate, hipCtxGetFlags, hipCtxPopCurrent, hipCtxGetCurrent,hipCtxSetCurrent, hipCtxPushCurrent, hipCtxSetCacheConfig, hipCtxSynchronize , hipCtxGetDevice

briefdescription.para: Pop the current/default context and return the popped context.

briefdescription.para: Get the handle of the device associated with current/default context.

simplesect.para: hipSuccess, hipErrorInvalidContext
hipCtxCreate, hipCtxDestroy, hipCtxGetFlags, hipCtxPopCurrent, hipCtxGetCurrent, hipCtxPushCurrent, hipCtxSetCacheConfig, hipCtxSynchronize

briefdescription.para: Returns the approximate HIP api version.

simplesect.para: The HIP feature set does not correspond to an exact CUDA SDK api revision. This function always set *apiVersion to 4 as an approximation though HIP supports some features which were introduced in later CUDA SDK revisions. HIP apps code should not rely on the api revision number here and should use arch feature flags to test device capabilities or conditional compilation.

briefdescription.para: Set Cache configuration for a specific function.

simplesect.para: AMD devices and some Nvidia GPUS do not support reconfigurable cache. This hint is ignored on those architectures.

briefdescription.para: Set L1/Shared cache partition.

simplesect.para: AMD devices and some Nvidia GPUS do not support reconfigurable cache. This hint is ignored on those architectures.

briefdescription.para: Set Shared memory bank configuration.

simplesect.para: AMD devices and some Nvidia GPUS do not support shared cache banking, and the hint is ignored on those architectures.

briefdescription.para: Blocks until the default context has completed all preceding requested tasks.

simplesect.para: This function waits for all streams on the default context to complete execution, and then returns.

briefdescription.para: Get the state of the primary context.

parameterdescription.para: to get primary context flags for
to store context state; 0 = inactive, 1 = active

briefdescription.para: Release the primary context on the GPU.

This function return hipSuccess though doesn't release the primaryCtx by design on HIP/HCC path.
